definition: to find time to do sth in the midst of pressing affairs
to push aside with the hand, foot, a stick etc/to dial/to allocate/to set aside (money)/to poke (the fire)/to pluck (a string instrument)/to turn round/classifier: group, batch

sentences.english: If you cannot attend, you may fill out the application form and send it back to us with a cheque.
sentences.chinese: 如未能撥冗出席，可填妥表格連同支票寄回。

sentences.english: That you didn't take that extra time for a smile, a hug, or a kiss.
sentences.chinese: 你沒有撥冗送給他人的那個微笑，那個擁抱或那個吻。

sentences.english: So thanks to all of you for taking the time to be here this evening.
sentences.chinese: 感謝大家今晚撥冗蒞臨。

sentences.english: This match will only have 36 precious seats, we sincerely invite you to attend this tournament.
sentences.chinese: 首屆比賽僅限36席珍貴席位，敬邀您撥冗參賽。

sentences.english: I want to thank you for taking time and for helping us out with this crowd-sourcing today.
sentences.chinese: 我要謝謝你們撥冗參與我們今天的節目。
